info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 3:36AM EDT until May 12 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Gray ME
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire...
Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire...
Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties.
...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in New Hampshire...
Piscataquog River near Goffstown affecting Hillsborough County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Warner River at Davisville.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Properties along Tom's Pond including Pine Lane in Warner are flooded with water overtopping retention walls.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EDT Sunday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 6.6 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
